title: Intro to Cryptography
description: Learn the fundamentals of cryptography: hashing, digital signatures, and keypairs.

conceptCard.title: Cryptography is the foundation of digital security
conceptCard.body: Every secure digital interaction relies on cryptography - from blockchain transactions to HTTPS connections.

steps.title: Understanding Hashing
steps.description: Generate hashes and understand hash properties.

steps.title: Hash Properties
steps.description: Demonstrate deterministic and one-way properties of hashes.

conceptCard.title: Signatures prove authenticity without revealing secrets
conceptCard.body: You can prove you authorized something without sharing your private key.

steps.title: Sign and Verify
steps.description: Sign a message and verify the signature.

steps.title: Knowledge Check
steps.description: Test your understanding of cryptography fundamentals.

questions.question: What is the main property of a hash function?
questions.explanation: Hash functions are one-way - you can't reverse them to get the original input.

questions.question: What happens if you change one character in a message before hashing?
questions.explanation: Good hash functions have the avalanche effect - small input changes cause large output changes.

questions.question: What can you do with a private key?
questions.explanation: Private keys are used to sign messages. Public keys are used to verify signatures.

questions.question: What can you do with a public key?
questions.explanation: Public keys are used to verify signatures created with the corresponding private key.

questions.question: True or False: You can derive a private key from a public key.
questions.explanation: This is computationally infeasible with modern cryptography. The security of digital signatures depends on this property.

questions.question: What does a valid digital signature prove?
options: Message came from signer and wasn't modified
questions.correctAnswer: Message came from signer and wasn't modified
questions.explanation: Digital signatures prove authenticity (came from signer) and integrity (wasn't modified).

questions.question: In blockchain, what are cryptographic signatures used for?
questions.explanation: Signatures prove you authorized a transaction without revealing your private key.

badge.name: Crypto Basics
badge.description: Completed the Intro to Cryptography track and demonstrated understanding of hashing, digital signatures, and keypairs.
